ColumnB: Role during and after treatment to prevent morbidity

Look for contractures, joint destructions and recurrent TB Repeat X-ray every 3 months (as clinically indicated) and at end of treatment to assess joint integrity Long-term follow-up for spinal TB for further collapse until age 18 years
Role during and after treatment to prevent morbidity
From diagnosis to maintain range of motion and prevent contractures
Provide night splints to immobilize joints in functional positions
Improve nutrition Give vitamin D and multivitamins
